Name: Lamp with head of Bes
Description: This lamp in terracotta belongs to a type of lamp with masks, called anvil or fan-shaped. They knew great success from the 2nd century BC to the end of the late  Hellenistic Period. In Egypt,  lamps were decorated with the face of a deity. This example shows the twisted features of Bes, protective genie destined to dispel the evil eye.
